title: Is the golden rule deontological? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think you can make a case that its a part of virtue theory (Christian or other) or from deontology (Kantian). I think both are viable interpretations. Both are ultimately true. Here’s the thing virtue theory subsumes (is bigger than and contains) deontology in a certain sense. Let’s look at the overall purpose: Kantian ethics is intended to find the rational and it does so through human dignity and fairness/justice.Christian ethics is intended to find the rational, but more so a deeper question of the Imagio Dei which includes more aspects of the human spirit.And it’s complicated to find the ways in which Dignity, Justice, and Love intersect and interrelate.
